column1: Go 49ers! Love the early lead...

The next time someone offers the stock market as a proxy for the health of the economy remind them that 44% of workers are in low-wage jobs earning a median income of only $18000/year and 34 million Americans know someone who died because they couldn’t afford medical treatment.
@johncusack @RepJayapal Thanks for all your work and advocacy @johncusack!
You have been extraordinary in all the early states and excited for you and Pramila to be with Senator Sanders in Iowa together tomorrow! https://t.co/9mmzGAc1Ph

China despite outrageous human rights abuses hasn’t been at war since 1979.   The U.S. has been in over 40 conflicts in that same time period.   America needs to stop the endless wars and lead in the battle to tackle the climate change crisis.

The same administration that is stripping food stamps from 700000 Americans to save $4.2 billion is also trying to cut disability benefits to save $2 billion over a decade.  Meanwhile our military budget has gone up by $120B since Obama left office.  https://t.co/ZoVluONnek

It's abhorrent for Trump to veto a bill that would regulate PFAS in our water — cancer-causing chemicals that are never expelled from the human body.  Congress must pass the WATER Act because every American deserves clean drinkable water. @BrendaLLawrence https://t.co/CUxYHGGPQI

A must read by ⁦@JosephEStiglitz⁩. To fix extractive capitalism we need: a $15 min wage expanded EITC stock buyback restrictions pro union policy limits on executive pay deduction tax on corporate welfare & tax policy that boosts employee pay. https://t.co/I1r3QXVEeG
Great to see the Warriors win last night and break their 10 game losing streak. Hoping we turn a corner and still a big believer in the team. @hbpurcell

An estimated 20000 Americans are dying prematurely every year because of chronic exposure to wildfire smoke.  That number could DOUBLE by the end of the century.  Our nation must invest in bold climate action to save lives.  https://t.co/D5vsBgatCN

Making sure that new projects don't have a negative environmental impact is common sense.  The real nightmare we’ll face is if we allow Trump to rollback regulations instead of taking immediate action on climate change. https://t.co/H3d0VmbX7r

The Fair Housing Act was passed in 1968 and over fifty years later we are still fighting to end segregation.  Now Trump is taking steps to weaken enforcement even further.  Together we must finally end housing discrimination in America. https://t.co/DocUirBfja

The same fossil fuel company that knew the harm they were causing for decades but ignored their own research spent over $100M lobbying Congress over the past decade.  New research finds that their Canadian subsidiary also knew as early as the 1960s. https://t.co/eC39lddNao

Special interests are going to spend billions to influence the 2020 election.   Here’s a reminder that if my Democracy Dollars program was in place in 2016 voters would have contributed more in small-dollar donations than all special interests combined. https://t.co/fX5wZKl0VQ
@aten099 @jentaub You’re kind. I love the House though!

Ordinary Americans don’t want the United States to enter more wars.  They want us to invest in good-paying jobs in their communities.   Anyone pushing for another endless war in the Middle East is out of touch with the public. https://t.co/hJNvAgGu4S

@aten099 @jentaub If you are for M4A stopping funding for bad wars free public college a big infrastructure bill then of course I’d say you’re progressive. Not all the leading Dems are for that. I will support whoever the nominee is enthusiastically! But there are real policy differences.
@aten099 @jentaub I appreciate that our party is a big tent with many candidates. I respect your support for progressive policies even if we may disagree about Senator Sanders.

@jentaub I appreciate your respectful engagement as well. One of Trump’s greatest harms has been corrupting the culture of dialogue in a multicultural multiracial democracy. We must rise above and affirm the promise for liberal democracy in our nation.

@jentaub There is absolutely no justification for anyone tweeting snakes at Senator Warren or any of her supporters —some who include women & people of color. It should stop. At the core of progressivism is respect for every participant & a belief in reasoned debate to advance a position.

@jentaub I have always spoken of Senator Warren & her work on bankruptcy law on the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau & on anti-corruption with respect and admiration and will continue to do so. Thank you for your work as well.
Very smart! https://t.co/32ROJ1Qa7J

While Trump has rolled back 95 environmental regulations since taking office and is now exempting large infrastructure projects from environmental review our planet is literally on fire.  This is a climate emergency. https://t.co/1W4LUNmr7z
@jsweeneys I will support with complete passion and commitment our nominee to defeat Trump.

If progressives attack each other that may depress turnout & a centrist Democrat can win. Anyone tempted to spend valuable time and energy arguing with fellow progressives should pick up the phone & call voters to boost turnout for stopping war M4A & free public college.

I know Trump has one governing philosophy: reverse ⁦⁦@BarackObama⁩. But really? He now is opposed to ⁦@MichelleObama⁩ initiative that kids should eat more fruits and vegetables?  https://t.co/qV6maiLFSf
Every citizen in the United States should be automatically registered to vote on their 18th birthday.

Evelyn Yang showed incredible courage in sharing her story in @DanaBashCNN’s poignant interview. As an Asian American I am particularly proud of the contributions @AndrewYang and Evelyn have made on key issues facing our nation. https://t.co/jWe4nvu9mc

If a corporation wants to build a new headquarters they should do it without engaging in a competition to see where they could get the biggest tax breaks.   New research finds that offering these tax incentives doesn’t boost economic growth. https://t.co/xEwzc2zHbe

State-by-state formerly incarcerated Americans are regaining the right to vote and participate in our democracy.  Our long-term goal must be to end felony disenfranchisement because nobody who served their time in prison should be banned from voting in the United States. https://t.co/3vyU10rPhu

States with automatic voter registration:   🗳️Maine 🗳️Illinois 🗳️Alaska 🗳️Oregon 🗳️Nevada 🗳️Georgia 🗳️Vermont 🗳️Michigan 🗳️Colorado 🗳️Maryland 🗳️California 🗳️New Jersey  🗳️Washington 🗳️West Virginia 🗳️Rhode Island 🗳️Massachusetts  Together we'll expand AVR nationwide.

When DAs charge high amounts for bail it creates a two-tiered system where the freedom of people who are legally innocent is based on the amount of money in their bank account.  New York should stand firm in protecting their new bail laws. https://t.co/7aozdjLIIG

The earthquakes continue in Puerto Rico as over 5000 people have been left homeless.  The largest power plant could take over a year to fully repair.   HUD must release the $18 billion in disaster relief funding that’s already been approved to help our fellow Americans rebuild.

Trump claims that Solemani had to be killed because Iran was planning an imminent attack on four American embassies.  Defense Secretary Esper never saw the evidence. Neither did Congress.  We must use the power of the purse to prevent another reckless war. https://t.co/xs0nqrPgpZ

Progressive policies are pro-business & we can earn the vote of Michael Brady. We are for entrepreneurship & wealth creation. Investing in health care education & infrastructure instead of bad wars will be good for American business & our economy. https://t.co/hl047xAKZw

If we want to prevent the re-emergence of ISIS why are we not investing in the reconstruction of Mosul where ISIS had a stronghold like the Marshall plan? Instead UAE is putting $50 million into rebuilding a Mosque. The people need hospitals roads schools and clean water.
@KatrinaLefever It can be college or some post secondary certification.

Apple provided the cloud & transactional info about the Saudi shooter at Pensacola. Third parties can unlock phones. But asking Apple to create a key to unlock any phone which is what AG Barr wants is handing a tech company or the government way too much power over citizens! https://t.co/0GNMLA79Gu

65% of jobs in 2020 will require education beyond K-12. That was 28%  in 1973. In today’s global economy we are cheating our young people if we only have an expectation that they finish high school. That’s why we need College/Trade school school for all.
So proud of Fremont & @LilyMei4Fremont future oriented leadership. https://t.co/hUJguaKdBX
Best of luck @HuntsmanAbby. You were terrific on the show and I have always appreciated how you have reached across the aisle and worked on issues to advance our nation.

@wirt_rick Not giving weapons. We need to call on regional partners to take the lead and help on intelligence/law enforcement and also find political solutions through diplomacy for a more inclusive government in Iraq.

16 years of US military presence in Iraq hasn’t eliminated violent extremists like ISIS so why do we think 16 more will? We need to responsibly withdraw and work with the Iraqis Kurds regional partners and NATO allies to defeat ISIS.

Less than 48 hours after Soleimani was killed @BernieSanders and I introduced a bill to block funding for offensive military action against Iran without Congressional approval.   Bernie’s leadership on opposing war is why America needs him as commander-in-chief. #DemDebate https://t.co/pH3J0FKAmT

I’m proud to be National Co-Chair for @BernieSanders because he has been consistent in opposing unconstitutional wars — whether in Vietnam Iraq Yemen or Iran.  He’s also voted against every single one of Trump’s military budget increases. #DemocraticDebate #DemDebate

@Jlo_Too @Sludge @WilliamFPeters2 Thank you for pointing that out. I have been very clear that those are part of my wife’s inherited assets before marriage. We file taxes separately and I have no control over that. I have no personal stock.

@randomsubu Zandi has no calculations for growth for infrastructure spending that most economists factor in. And he should be cautious making blanket predictions given how wrong he was in 2016. A little more humility from pundits please. Don’t claim false expertise!
@ClayShentrup I am for massive more investment in housing so that we can build more affordable housing near transit.
@Evan_Low @BernieSanders .@Evan_Low you’re a great friend and I am excited about your next steps and future!

.@economics_ma Zandi says that Bernie’s policies would slow growth to 1.75%. Did you take into account the growth from spending on infrastructure & jobs? Your prediction that unemployment would be 7% if Trump were elected is dead wrong. Voters are skeptical of insider pundits.
All figures are adjusted for inflation (2018 $)

The student debt crisis in America:  1998 - 1999: 🎓 Public college cost (w/room & board): $12000  💵 Starting salary for bachelor degree graduate: $52873   2018 - 2019: 🎓 Public college cost (w/room & board): $21370  💵 Starting salary for bachelor degree graduate: $50944

Is anyone else outraged that other industrialized nations are paying a fraction of what we pay for prescription drugs even though every drug approved by the FDA from 2010 - 2016 was developed with publicly-funded NIH research? https://t.co/NM8YYzTuI6

It’s an absolute outrage that 45000 Americans die every year because they don’t have health insurance.   With Medicare for All nobody will have to delay their treatment because they lost their coverage or have a high deductible plan. https://t.co/JjwH615s6n

When there are 137 million Americans who report financial hardship due to medical costs I don’t want to hear one person tell me that our current health care system provides “choice” and “freedom” to people. https://t.co/iCdOiIzLFl

The cost of healthcare education and housing have risen over the past decade so why is the federal minimum wage still $7.25?  In 2020 we will keep fighting to give the working class the raises they deserve and make sure that everyone in America earns a living wage. #FightFor15 https://t.co/A5nieAATFE

Making the case for @BernieSanders on the @DailyBriefing earlier today! Our movement is about fighting for the working class and not getting involved in endless unconstitutional wars. https://t.co/DJQzxTNb4I

Why is it that many of those who oppose Medicare for All and claim that Americans love their insurance companies never seem to want to talk about the astronomical costs of our current system? https://t.co/npjW7KNq8Y

It was not his moment but @CoryBooker appealed to our better angels with his message of unity & love. He has been the lead voice on criminal justice reform. He will be a major leader in a post-Trump multicultural multiracial progressive era. America is lucky to have his voice. https://t.co/7D8LMJwBQf

Outstanding student debt has more than doubled over the past decade and it’s made it harder for an entire generation to take part in the American Dream and build a middle class life.  The next decade must be defined by student debt relief and college and trade schools for all. https://t.co/bTka5LZQ1x

Approximately 233000 people have died from fighting hunger and disease in Yemen in 2019.  That's 0.8% of Yemen's entire population.  In 2020 we must end the war in Yemen. #YemenCantWait https://t.co/Mv75HQwYjt

How did Big Pharma celebrate the new year?  By raising the price on more than 250 drugs.  With millions of Americans rationing or skipping their medication because they can't afford it 2020 must be the year we finally lower prescription drug prices. https://t.co/7z8U8Lxirl
Proud to work with @RepBrendanBoyle & @katieporteroc to make sure our party is unified behind our nominee from day one. Thanks Brendan for your incredible leadership on this. https://t.co/tWl65jbutM

How much longer will we send our brave servicemembers to fight endless wars with no debates no boundaries and no clear objective?  In 2020 we must finally repeal the Authorization for Use of Military Force.

The tax cut passed by Republicans two years ago was great for corporations but what about for ordinary Americans who've faced decades of stagnant wages?  Expanding the Earned Income Tax Credit would give a much deserved raise to the middle and working class. https://t.co/kj0ovsmBvT

@SRuhle @NBCNews @JoshNBCNews @MikeBloomberg I do respect @MikeBloomberg for focusing his ads against Trump as opposed to our candidates and committing to help support digital and field organizing regardless of who the nominee is. We will need that kind of unity to defeat Trump. @daveweigel
@mikeypeters I have great respect for Senator Warren as does Bernie Sanders and have always expressed my admiration for her work.

Our nation cannot afford another trillion dollar war in the Middle East and with @BernieSanders as Commander in Chief we will stop unconstitutional wars that are causing death and pursue a foreign policy to affirm life.

At age 40 I was elected to represent the most powerful economic district in the world in Silicon Valley.   What @BernieSanders asks is simple: If this country can give that opportunity to the son of immigrants is it too much to ask to give that opportunity to every American?

I had the chance to go to preschool and get a quality public school education.  I never had to worry about affording a hot lunch.  I had healthcare and lived in a community with clean air and clean water.  There were schoolteachers and little league coaches who believed in me.

My grandfather spent 4 years in jail with Gandhi fighting for independence. My parents immigrated here in the 1970s. I was born in Pennsylvania in 1976 and grew up in Bucks County PA.   @BernieSanders wants every person in America to have the same opportunities that I did.

I was honored to introduce @BernieSanders in Iowa City Iowa today. With Bernie as president we will stop the unconstitutional wars so that America can lead in the battle to tackle the climate change crisis. https://t.co/vUDQ01J2Uv

If you are wondering why it’s so hard to pass Medicare for All College for All and other policies popular with the American people check out the increasing influence of PAC money on our elections:    ➡️ 2010: $1.2B ➡️ 2012: $1.4B ➡️ 2014: $1.7B ➡️ 2016: $2.2B ➡️ 2018: $3.1B
Love the energy and passion of @wiforbernie2020. You will help us win both Iowa and Wisconsin! https://t.co/VgiPmjGabG
Most Democrats support Medicare for All and our huge goal for 2020 must be bringing it closer to reality — both in Congress and in the White House. https://t.co/Ud2THtDSWj

It’s not enough to legalize marijuana if people are still stuck with criminal records for use.   Chicago just cleared thousands of marijuana records on the eve of legalization.  Expanding this nationwide would begin to make up for the failed war on drugs. https://t.co/1yKpYyxSZY

When we talk about how millions of Americans can’t afford an urgent expense without taking on debt these are the types of expenses we are talking about:   🏥 Medical emergency 🏠 Home repair 🚗 Car issues

After only two days of work in 2020 many CEOs have earned more than the average worker will make in the whole year.   If a corporation pays their executives more than 150X what the median workers make they shouldn’t be allowed to buyback their stock. https://t.co/hJxgrnOK5M

In the 1930s rural electrification programs were funded by massive federal investment because companies driven by profit had no motivation to go into certain areas.   Expanding renewable energy to every corner of America will require many municipal-owned utilities.

All across the state there is enthusiasm for @SenSanders. Iowa is responding to his message of stopping the war in Iran. Love the turnout for canvasses in Fort Dodge and Waterloo https://t.co/0x1N2i5Jmu

As drug-resistant infections sicken millions every year Big Pharma has stopped investing in R&D for antibiotics because they can’t find a way to profit.   We must increase NIH funding to develop drugs that save lives regardless of the profit margin. https://t.co/0cMMPf5RdG

The towering genius of what Obama did to overcome structural barriers in 2008 looks even more impressive through the lens of recent history. @davidaxelrod. We still have a long way to go but the work of @aimeeallison & @rashadrobinson gives me hope for the future. https://t.co/DzemzqazVk

2009: 🏠 New home price: $290300 🎓 Public 4-year college tuition: $8420 🍴 Annual food expenses: $6392 💵 Federal minimum wage: $7.25  2019: 🏠 New home price: $362700 🎓 Public 4-year college tuition: $10440 🍴 Annual food expenses: $7923 💵 Federal minimum wage: $7.25
@DonMcDowell @smokeyrow Sorry I didn’t say hi. Here all weekend. Next time we run into each other please introduce yourself.

Over 5 inches of snow on the ground did not deter @BernieSanders volunteers from coming out to canvass in Ankeny and Des Moines. We will win because we have the most dedicated volunteers. https://t.co/G711aspk9v

It was such an honor to see my friend @AGIowa Tom Miller who today became the longest serving Attorney General in US history — 37 years. In an age of Trump Miller is an example of the best of public service and love of country. https://t.co/HW4UVKwWvh

Knee replacements and heart surgeries aren’t drastically different in other countries.   So why are major surgeries so much more expensive in the United States?  Medicare for All will lower the astronomical costs of our system while guaranteeing healthcare as a human right. https://t.co/mryOR04g34
We will not go back to the days before Roe v. Wade.
Thank you for your consistent and principled voice @SenMikeLee in stopping the war in Yemen and now preventing a war with Iran. https://t.co/CNS0bUAmHE
Every American in the 21st century should have access to:  🏠  Housing 🔌  Electricity  🏥  Healthcare 🍽️  Basic nutrition 💻  High-speed Broadband 🎓  Education including colleges and trade schools

The health of our economy shouldn’t be measured simply by the stock market.   It should be measured by the fact that hundreds of thousands of Americans are going bankrupt due to medical costs and 40 percent can’t afford a significant emergency expense without going into debt.
@jjoeaz @mattgaetz It takes congressional authorization like we had to go after the terrorists who attacked us on 9/11 and Osama Bin Laden. I strongly supported that.

The question is not whether we can afford to pay to address climate change.  The question is do we pay for decisive action now or do we pay to clean up the damage from strengthening storms droughts and wildfires?  Bold climate action costs less than doing nothing.

This list of cities that will reach a $15/hour minimum wage in 2020 shows the power of the #FightFor15 movement.   While progress continues to be made too many Americans are still being left behind.  In 2020 I will keep fighting for a $15/hour federal minimum wage. https://t.co/y0U6xuKH6D

.@mattgaetz showed courage & independence in voting for the War Powers Resolution. We have strong differences on issues including the legality of the Soleimani killing but no one should question his sincerity about preventing endless wars & military interventionism.

Yesterday the House used the power of the purse to prevent Trump from starting another Middle East war.  Averting reckless war is not a partisan cause — it's a humanitarian one.  The Senate must follow suit by passing the War Powers Resolution. https://t.co/czVmVrnenT

Voting rights restored in 2019:  ➡️ New Jersey: 80000+  ➡️ Kentucky: 140000+  ➡️ Nevada: 77000 ➡️ Louisiana: ~40000   This is only the beginning.   In 2020 we will keep fighting to end felony disenfranchisement across America.

As more than 200 members of Congress — mostly Republicans — sign a letter urging the Supreme Court to reconsider Roe v. Wade here’s a reminder that abortion rights aren’t the partisan issue that many conservatives would have you believe.  Most Americans are in support. https://t.co/loWvow14OO
Universal healthcare: 🇩🇪: ✅ 🇸🇪: ✅ 🇳🇴: ✅ 🇫🇷: ✅ 🇺🇸: ❌  Paid family leave: 🇩🇪: ✅ 🇸🇪: ✅ 🇳🇴: ✅ 🇫🇷: ✅ 🇺🇸: ❌  Free college tuition 🇩🇪: ✅ 🇸🇪: ✅ 🇳🇴: ✅ 🇫🇷: ✅ 🇺🇸: ❌

Iowa is now the only state with a lifetime voting ban for all formerly incarcerated people without the governor's individual approval — leaving 52000 Iowans unable to vote.    Every 2020 candidate should demand an end to felony disenfranchisement in Iowa. https://t.co/CC6FgM125Y

Basic healthcare education and electricity should be available for all.  That means passing Medicare for All pushing for public ownership of utilities like PG&E and investing in public education instead of for-profit charter schools.

Republicans want to claim that their policies have increased prosperity for every American but ordinary people know the truth when they see their paychecks.   To create an economy for all we must expand the EITC strengthen unions and make sure every worker earns a living wage. https://t.co/h8wOJ2cECe

Acres burned in wildfires over the past two years:   🔥 California (2018): 2M 🔥 Amazon (2019): 2.2M 🔥 Siberia (2019): 6.7M 🔥 Australia (2019): 12M  How many acres have to burn before we finally put the health of our planet and future generations over special interests?

Here it is. After years of legal challenges on the state-level Republicans are now revealing their long-term goal:   Overturning Roe v. Wade even though most Americans support reproductive rights.   We won't let them rollback women’s reproductive rights. https://t.co/Zu4jVy7TT4

Wildfires burned 12M acres in Australia in 2019 and half a billion animals died — the hottest and driest year in the nation's history.   Entire species could have been lost.  With climate change destroying ecosystems we can’t wait any longer on action.  https://t.co/3wSjG11ym9

@jimbojones2011 @alexkotch @Sludge As explained in article I have zero investments in Fossil Fuels. The investments are from my wife’s separate wealth prior to marriage and we file taxes separately. @alexkotch article is very fair.

This endorsement for @BernieSanders is a very big deal. Thanks for your leadership @VarshPrakash & @evanlweber. Proud to be an early supporter of the Green New Deal & excited to participate in the climate townhall with @sunrisemvmt & Sanders in Iowa on Sunday! https://t.co/R2QMazsDuU

My heart is with all those in Puerto Rico after they suffered their worst earthquake in the last hundred years.  We failed the island in the aftermath of Hurricane Maria and we can’t fail them now.  Our fellow Americans deserve a just recovery. https://t.co/JWL1c8OpoT

The American people will come together tomorrow at 5pm local time in cities and towns in every corner of this nation to demand that we aren’t driven into another costly Middle East war.   Find a #NoWarWithIran protest happening near you: https://t.co/Tms7lG2xB1

Is Congress listening to the majority of Americans who don’t want to repeat the mistakes of the Iraq War?   RT if you agree that Congress should stop funding any offensive military action against Iran. #NoWarWithIran
